- DOWN -> (7,5): technically safe this turn, but risky next—many adjacent cells are our own or opponent body (8,5 is our body, 7,4 is our tail). Leaves very few escape routes.
- UP -> (7,7): safe, high mobility. Keeps multiple exits (can go left, right later, or continue up), stays flexible to react to opponent moves, avoids head-on risk since opponent can’t move into (7,7) in one step from (5,8).

Enemy likely moves: they can’t go down; they may try to move RIGHT toward (6,8) or UP to (5,9). We want to pressure their left corridor without cornering ourselves. We’re behind on apples -> don’t force a head-on KO. Stay aggressive but live to fight.

Short-term plan (next few turns):
- This turn: preserve mobility and pressure options — go UP to (7,7). 🙌
- Next turns: watch if they drift right/up. If they give us space, pivot LEFT to (6,7) then (5,7) only if it’s safe and not into their body. Try to collapse their accessible area around x=3–6 while keeping one clear escape route. If they attempt to bait a head-on, bail out — we don’t have the apple lead to risk double KO. 🍎⚖️

Alright chat — play it tight, play it smart, apply pressure but don’t overcommit. Ready? Let’s hit it.
